headline: Citigroup Stock Up on AO Citibank Sale, Sees $4B CET1 Gain in Q1
summary: C stock gains 2.2% as it completes AO Citibank sale to RenCap, marking full exit from Russia and boosting capital by $4B.

raw.headline: Citigroup Stock Up on AO Citibank Sale, Sees $4B CET1 Gain in Q1

headline: Citi says growth–cyclical barbell still favored as earnings broaden in 2026
summary: Investing.com -- Citi is maintaining its stance that investors should balance exposure between growth and cyclical equities, with analyst Drew Pettit emphasising in a note on Thursday that the firm’s focus “remains on barbelling risk between Growth and Cyclicals” in what it sees as a more volatile stage of the U.S. bull market.

headline: What Analysts Think Is Changing The Story For Winnebago Industries (WGO)
summary: The latest work on Winnebago Industries edges fair value up from US$48.42 to US$49.33, as analysts respond to Citi’s recent US$3 target move with a more refined, but still measured, narrative. A slightly lower discount rate and a small trim to revenue growth assumptions sit behind this, pointing to a view that current headwinds are largely recognized in the stock while expectations stay grounded. Continue with this article to see how you can keep on top of these shifting assumptions and the...

headline: Reassessing The Narrative For Airbus (ENXTPA:AIR) As Analyst Views Start To Diverge
summary: Airbus’s fair value estimate has been nudged slightly higher, moving from €224.25 to €225.11. This lines up with recent research where some firms are lifting targets while others are turning more cautious. That modest shift captures a market that is still willing to recognize Airbus’s progress but is also paying closer attention to execution risks and how comfortably the current share price reflects existing plans. Stay tuned to see how you can track these kinds of price target tweaks and...

headline: Citigroup vs Wells Fargo: Which Wins on Dividends, Buybacks, Interest Rate Exposure?
summary: Wells Fargo (NYSE: WFC) and Citigroup (NYSE: C) both reported Q4 2025 earnings on January 14, 2026, yet investors sold off both stocks despite solid results. The selloff reflects concern over net interest income pressure in a higher-for-longer rate environment. Since January 1, 2026, Wells Fargo has declined 4.98% while Citigroup has slipped just 0.36%, ... Citigroup vs Wells Fargo: Which Wins on Dividends, Buybacks, Interest Rate Exposure?

headline: Why Citi Views VeriSign, Inc. (VRSN)’s Dip as an Attractive Entry Point
summary: VeriSign, Inc. (NASDAQ:VRSN) is among the most profitable software stocks to buy now. On February 9, Citi trimmed the price target on VeriSign, Inc. (NASDAQ:VRSN) to $280 from $337 and maintained a Buy rating, TheFly reported. According to the firm, the post-earnings pullback offers an appealing entry point, with the company’s fundamentals remaining solid amid […]

headline: Looking At The Severn Trent LSE SVT Story After Mixed Rating Shifts
summary: The latest update on Severn Trent edges the fair value estimate to £30.22 per share versus £30.20 previously, with a discount rate of 7.20% compared with 7.07% and long term revenue growth assumptions held at 9.89%. This small tweak reflects a balance between recent research upgrades that support the earnings outlook and a more cautious stance from others who highlight sensitivity to the discount rate and regulatory decisions on growth. Stay tuned to see how you can track these kinds of...

headline: Is This Dividend Stock a Buy Now After Falling Over 11% from Its 2026 Highs?
summary: Citigroup shares are down 11% from their 2026 highs. The stock has a healthy dividend yield of 2.1% and looks like a good buy after the correction.
